stheno.random module¶

class stheno.random.Normal[source]¶

Bases: stheno.random.RandomVector, plum.parametric.Kind, plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Normal random variable.

A normal random variable also acts as in instance of At, which can be used to specify a process at particular points.

Parameters

  • var (tensor or matrix.Dense) – Variance of the distribution.

  • mean (tensor, optional) – Mean of the distribution. Defaults to zero.

dim¶

Dimensionality.

dtype¶

Data type.

entropy()[source]¶

Compute the entropy.

Returns

The entropy.

Return type

scalar

get()[source]¶

Get the point at which the the process was evaluated to construct the distribution.

This method must be implemented to act as an instance of Act.

Returns

Point at which the process was evaluated.

Return type

input

kl = <function <function Normal.kl> with 1 method(s)>[source]¶
lmatmul(other)[source]¶
logpdf(x)[source]¶

Compute the log-pdf.

Parameters

x (input) – Values to compute the log-pdf of.

Returns

Log-pdf for every input in x. If it can be

determined that the list contains only a single log-pdf, then the list is flattened to a scalar.

Return type

list[tensor]

m2¶

Second moment.

marginals()[source]¶

Get the marginals.

Returns

A tuple containing the predictive means and lower and

upper 95% central credible interval bounds.

Return type

tuple

mean¶

Mean.

rmatmul(other)[source]¶
sample(num=1, noise=None)[source]¶

Sample from the distribution.

Parameters

  • num (int) – Number of samples.

  • noise (scalar, optional) – Variance of noise to add to the samples. Must be positive.

Returns

Samples as rank 2 column vectors.

Return type

tensor

var¶

Variance.

w2 = <function <function Normal.w2> with 1 method(s)>[source]¶
class stheno.random.Normal1D(var, mean=None)[source]¶

Bases: stheno.random.Normal, plum.resolvable.Referentiable

A one-dimensional version of random.Normal with convenient broadcasting behaviour.

Parameters

  • var (scalar or vector) – Variance of the distribution.

  • mean (scalar or vector) – Mean of the distribution, defaults to zero.
